title: zasad@
author: zasad@
content: https://www.forbes.com/sites/johnhyatt/2024/04/02/the-richest-crypto-and-bitcoin-billionaires-in-the-world-2024/?sh=1bf1dacb726b"That’s helped make at least 17 people crypto billionaires, according to Forbes’ 2024 World’s Billionaires list, up from nine crypto billionaires last year. These 17 investors and entrepreneurs are worth a collective $93 billion, between their estimated crypto asset holdings, publicly disclosed stock holdings and private assets. That’s more than double the $37 billion in collective crypto billionaire wealth last year.For the third year running, Changpeng Zhao, founder and former CEO of crypto exchange Binance, is crypto’s wealthiest person. Despite pleading guilty to U.S. money laundering charges in November, CZ, as he’s known, is now worth an estimated $33 billion, up from $10.5 billion last year. That makes him the biggest crypto gainer in dollar terms since last year and the 50th-wealthiest person in the world. The bulk of his fortune comes from his majority stake in Binance, which remains the industry’s largest global trading venue by volume.1. Changpeng ZhaoNet worth: $33 billion (vs. $10.5 billion) | Source of wealth: Binance"__4 billion in fines isn't a lot of money to him.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: zasad@ on April 04, 2024, 10:43:08 AM4 billion in fines isn't a lot of money to him. Isn't? Man, it's 33 billion dollars left. But we probably need to put this into normal people's perspective.Imagine if you have 37 thousand dollars ($37,000). But you are hit with a $4000 fine or some other kind of unforseeen expense, which is very common to happen at least once to people, that's going to leave you with 33,000 dollars left, and if there is no cashflow to replace that lost $4000 quickly, then you are not going to recover that.Losing money is a big deal to everyone, it's why you have super rich people complaining about losing lots of money on social media.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: A few years ago people never thought that just hodling Bitcoin would make people very rich. Cryptocurrencies created an opportunity for commoners in society to become wealthy without any political or economic connections to the society's high-class citizens. In some countries, you cannot come out of poverty if you don't have the connections. Through DCA an average worker can be able to earn a good amount of money over a period. It will be difficult to ascertain the financial worth of these billionaires since some of them run some centralized organization that handles people's funds, but the list looks fair. And I also think that there are also some unknown Bitcoin billionaires who choose to remain anonymous.

comments.author: legendbtc
comments.body: QuoteThe Richest Crypto And Bitcoin Billionaires In The World 2024This is an admirable and proud achievement for bitcoin and cryptocurrency investors. But I hope not many people look at this result and start to have the illusion that this is easy and that just investing in cryptocurrency can be easily achieved. I see many people still dream that just by investing a few hundred dollars, a few thousand dollars, they can earn a few million dollars when coming to this market. Or some people think that just buying, holding and not working for a few years can become rich. Many people have the wrong mindset when starting to participate in the market because of news like this.

comments.author: Smartprofit
comments.body: In fact, I have respect for people who have sold all their real estate, sold all their possessions and invested in Bitcoin.  This is how great fortunes are created.  The amount of your wealth is directly proportional to your willingness to take risks.  In addition, intuition and faith are important (by faith I do not mean religious beliefs, but commitment to one’s ideas).  The idea that Bitcoin will eventually become the world's reserve currency and its value will exceed $1,000,000 is a bold idea.  But people who believed in the prospects of Bitcoin and took appropriate action became rich people.  Bitcoin is one of the most amazing opportunities for a person of the 21st century to gain real wealth!  At the same time, this opportunity was provided to all people - all people on planet Earth had the opportunity to buy the first cryptocurrency.  Our descendants will then discuss this situation with surprise and wonder why such a small number of people were able to improve their financial situation with the help of Bitcoin - after all, this was one of the most global redistributions of world wealth in the world history of mankind.

Whether that kind of person has 5 billion or 30 billion or 100 billion doesn't matter to them, its not like they are actually ever spending that money, its just wealth to keep growing. The actual money CZ needs for living his life is a tiny tiny fraction of his wealth. He doesn't have to replace it, because he'll never need it in the first place. And it is nothing compared to how his crypto wealth will grow in the future. He could gain $4 billion in a good WEEK in the market.

comments.body: I don't think that there's anything good about being a billionaire, but since they exist anyway, having some from the crypto industry is good for balance and for cryptos to be taken as a serious industry. I'm surprised CZ actually has more money now than before. That being said, not everyone on the list made most of their money in cryptos, so looking at net worth of people who are billionaires and are involved in crypto businesses and calling those people 'crypto billionaires' is misleading. For example, the Winklevoss brothers are on the list, but they didn't become billionaires because of Bitcoin, did they?
